newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINLAND EYES NESTE-IVO DEVELOPMENT - NESTE .
newsitem.headline: FINLAND EYES NESTE-IVO DEVELOPMENT - NESTE .

text.p: Finnish state-controlled oil, chemicals and energy group Neste Oy said on Tuesday that the ministry of trade and industry would study a broadening of its and state-owned power group Imatran Voima Oy's ownership bases and options for the joint development of the two companies.

The ministry would undertake a review to "evaluate the options for broadening the shareholder base and the structural alternatives for joint development of the two companies," Neste said in a statement.
The review would be prepared in cooperation with the managements of Neste and IVO, Neste said.

"The combined strengths of the companies will offer maximum access to growth opportunities in the Nordic region, Russia and the Baltic area and will allow a significant position to be built in the gas and electricity markets of North and central Europe," Neste said.
"Neste and IVO together have core competencies across the whole energy chain," it said.
"Neste's board considers that it is very important that any proposed solution is in the interests of all Neste's shareholders," it added.
In a separate statement, IVO said the ministry's review was scheduled to be completed by the end of August.
